title: Corradini - Partitura del Primo Libro - Aulos Csrt [Philidor]
description:
There's not much available in English about Nicolo Corradini, save that he was among the most highly regarded composers in mid-17th century Cremona. Much of his time was spent as an organist and composer of sacred works, though he is known to have written several secular collections (such as madrigals) that have not survived. His style was modern, affected by both the Gabrielis, Frescobaldi, and Merulo. It's believed he kept up correspondence and an exchange of manuscripts with other musicians throughout Itally and abroad, which probably accounts for the sophisticated character of his secular music  heard here.

Transfers are made at 768 kBits/s, directly from the disc.

A bio of Corradini is enclosed. You can search on Philidor for all my classical downloads, or check out this thread:
 
https://pirates-forum.org/Thread-Philidor-s-uploads--63895
